title: lianapy
description: Performs LIANA integration based as described in https://github.com/saezlab/liana-py

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output h5mu file.

layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Layer in anndata.AnnData.layers to use. If None, use mudata.mod[modality].X.

groupby.description: Type: `string`, required. The key of the observations grouping to consider
groupby.help_text: Type: `string`, required. The key of the observations grouping to consider.

resource_name.description: Type: `string`, default: `consensus`, choices: ``baccin2019`, `cellcall`, `cellchatdb`, `cellinker`, `cellphonedb`, `celltalkdb`, `connectomedb2020`, `consensus`, `embrace`, `guide2pharma`, `hpmr`, `icellnet`, `italk`, `kirouac2010`, `lrdb`, `mouseconsensus`, `ramilowski2015``. Name of the resource to be loaded and use for ligand-receptor inference
resource_name.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `consensus`, choices: ``baccin2019`, `cellcall`, `cellchatdb`, `cellinker`, `cellphonedb`, `celltalkdb`, `connectomedb2020`, `consensus`, `embrace`, `guide2pharma`, `hpmr`, `icellnet`, `italk`, `kirouac2010`, `lrdb`, `mouseconsensus`, `ramilowski2015``. Name of the resource to be loaded and use for ligand-receptor inference.

gene_symbol.description: Type: `string`, default: `gene_symbol`. Column name in var DataFrame in which gene symbol are stored
gene_symbol.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `gene_symbol`. Column name in var DataFrame in which gene symbol are stored.

expr_prop.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.1`. Minimum expression proportion for the ligands/receptors (and their subunits) in the corresponding cell identities
expr_prop.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.1`. Minimum expression proportion for the ligands/receptors (and their subunits) in the corresponding cell identities. Set to '0', to return unfiltered results.

min_cells.description: Type: `integer`, default: `5`. Minimum cells per cell identity ('groupby') to be considered for downstream analysis
min_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `5`. Minimum cells per cell identity ('groupby') to be considered for downstream analysis.

aggregate_method.description: Type: `string`, default: `rra`, choices: ``mean`, `rra``. Method aggregation approach, one of ['mean', 'rra'], where 'mean' represents the mean rank, while 'rra' is the RobustRankAggregate (Kolde et al
aggregate_method.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rra`, choices: ``mean`, `rra``. Method aggregation approach, one of ['mean', 'rra'], where 'mean' represents the mean rank, while 'rra' is the RobustRankAggregate (Kolde et al., 2014) of the interactions.

return_all_lrs.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Bool whether to return all LRs, or only those that surpass the 'expr_prop' threshold
return_all_lrs.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Bool whether to return all LRs, or only those that surpass the 'expr_prop' threshold. Those interactions that do not pass the 'expr_prop' threshold will be assigned to the *worst* score of the ones that do. 'False' by default.

n_perms.description: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. Number of permutations for the permutation test
n_perms.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. Number of permutations for the permutation test. Note that this is relevant only for permutation-based methods - e.g. 'CellPhoneDB

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
